memberdef.argsstring: (const long double &random_number, const long double &speciation_rate, const unsigned long &no_generations) override
memberdef.name: calcSpeciation

briefdescription.para: Calculates the speciation probability from the random number, speciation rate and number of generations a lineage has existed for.

parameterdescription.para: the generated random number from 0-1
the speciation rate to be applied
the number of generations a lineage has existed for

briefdescription.para: Performs the actual speciation. Includes handling of speciated lineages under protracted conditions.

parameterdescription.para: the position in the array of TreeNodes for this lineage

briefdescription.para: Gets the protractedness of the simulation. Overridden by protracted child classes.
Sets the protracted variables.

parameterdescription.para: the minimum number of generations to have passed before speciation is allowed
the maximum number of generations a lineage can exist for before it is speciated.

briefdescription.para: Gets the protracted variables and returns them as a single, newline separated string.

simplesect.para: string containing the protracted variables, separated by newlines.

briefdescription.para: Gets the minimum number of generations a lineage must exist.

simplesect.para: double the number of generations a lineage must exist

briefdescription.para: Gets the maximum number of generations a lineage can exist.

simplesect.para: double the number of generations a lineage must exist

briefdescription.para: Outputs the protracted variables to a string.

detaileddescription.para: This function is intended to be overridden by derived classes. It is intended the output is used for writing to SQL databases.

simplesect.para: string containing a list of the protracted speciation variables.

briefdescription.para: Applies the given speciation rate to the tree.

simplesect.para: Currently this just copies code from the version in tree, which is not ideal, but this avoids creating an extra function.

parameterdescription.para: the required speciation rate

briefdescription.para: Import the simulation variables from the command line structure.

detaileddescription.para: This function parses the simulation variables, imports them (from either the command line or a config file), checks that the input files exist and checks for any paused simulations. The flags are then set correctly, meaning that setup() and runSim() can be run immediately afterwards.

parameterdescription.para: a vector of strings, containing the command-line arguments

briefdescription.para: Sets up the simulation parameters from the one provided.

detaileddescription.para:
Intended for usage with metacommunity application. No output directory is expected.
sim_parameters_in
the simulation parameters to set up the simulation with

briefdescription.para: Asserts that the output directory is not null and exists. If it doesn't exist, it attempts to create it.

parameterdescription.para: if the output directory creation fails

briefdescription.para: Checks for existing paused simulations to resume from Sets bPaused if there are.

detaileddescription.para: This version uses the default values read from the config file.

briefdescription.para: Checks for existing paused simulations to resume from.

detaileddescription.para: Sets bPaused if there are.
This version uses the values supplied to the function directly

parameterdescription.para: the output directory to check for
the seed for paused sims
the task for paused sims

briefdescription.para: Move the parameters from the sim_parameters object to their relevant parameters.
Gets the has_paused variable for resuming sims.
Gets the map autocorrel times.
Getter for the simulation seed.
Sets the simulation seed for the random number generator.

detaileddescription.para: This function should only be called once.
The seed is set within the NR object. This will be fixed for the simulation and is only performed once.

parameterdescription.para: the desired seed to set for the simulation

briefdescription.para: Gets the initial number of individuals.

simplesect.para: the number of initial individuals to simulate

briefdescription.para: Sets the sizes of grid, active and data, based on the number of individuals counted from the samplemask.

simplesect.para: a count of the number of individuals that exist in the simulation

briefdescription.para: The setup function for generating the simulation objects.

detaileddescription.para: The simulation parameters are set from comargs using setParameters(). Generates and fills the active and grid objects as well as importing all the maps from the supplied files.

briefdescription.para: Sets the starting values for required parameters.
Sets the variables at the start of a simulation for temporary data.

detaileddescription.para: This is not the main set-up routine, which creates the permanent data structures including maps, the coalescence tree and active lineage listings.

briefdescription.para: Prints the statement for the setup initiation.

detaileddescription.para: This is stored in a separate function so that it can be called in isolation by child classes.

briefdescription.para: Sets the temporal sampling points from the time config file.
Determines the speciation rates to apply and then applies them to the coalescence tree post-simulation.

detaileddescription.para: Detects speciation rates from the config files supplied.

briefdescription.para: Assigns the objects sizes in memory and fills with the starting lineages.
Fills the active and data objects with the starting lineages.

parameterdescription.para: the number of individuals expected to exist

briefdescription.para: Run the entire simulation given the start conditions already defined by setup()

detaileddescription.para: Setup is assumed to have been run already. This function is the main function containing the main loop of the simulation. At the end of the simulation, returns true if the simulation is complete, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Writes to the console that the simulation is beginning.
Write the step counter to console. This function should only be called in debugging mode.
Increments the generation counter and step references.
Chooses a random lineage from active.

detaileddescription.para: The index of the random lineage is stored in this_step, as chosen. Also records the required variables for the step process, like x, y position.

briefdescription.para: Updates the coalescence variables in the step object.
Speciation to supplied lineage.

detaileddescription.para:
Also calls the removeOldPos() and switchPositions() functions for removing the lineage out of active reference.
chosen

briefdescription.para: Removes the old position within active.

parameterdescription.para: the desired active reference to remove from the grid.

briefdescription.para: Switches the chosen position with the endactive position.

parameterdescription.para: the chosen lineage to switch with endactive.

briefdescription.para: Calculates the next step for the simulation.
Perform the coalescence between lineages. Once coalesced, lineages are removed from the active scope.

parameterdescription.para: the chosen lineage for coalescence
the target lineage for coalscence

briefdescription.para: Checks if the number of lineages should be expanded at another sample point.
Adds the required lineages at the generation time.

parameterdescription.para: the generation to add lineages at

briefdescription.para: Checks the size of the main active and data objects is large enough.

parameterdescription.para: the required data object size
the required active object size

briefdescription.para: Sets the active reference to a tip, if it isn't one already. Otherwise, creates a new tip for the new generation time.

parameterdescription.para: the reference in active
the generation to set for the new lineage

briefdescription.para: Creates a new reference in data containing the tip with a new generation counter.

parameterdescription.para: the reference in active of the lineage to make a tip
the generation to make the lineage a tip at

briefdescription.para: Finalises the simulation, and performs the correct tasks depending if the sim has been paused or finished.
Applies the given speciation rate to the tree.

parameterdescription.para: the required speciation rate
the required time of speciation

briefdescription.para: Overloaded version of applySpecRates for the default generation (0.0).

parameterdescription.para: the speciation rate to apply to the tree

briefdescription.para: Applies the given speciation rate to the tree, but does not output to a file. Instead returns a pointer to the nodes object.

parameterdescription.para: the required speciation rate
the required time of speciation

briefdescription.para: Gets the sorted cumulative species abundances from the contained TreeList.

detaileddescription.para:
For use with metacommunity applications
row of cumulative species abundances

briefdescription.para: Sets up the generation of the tree object.

parameterdescription.para: the required speciation rate
the required time of speciation

briefdescription.para: Applies multiple speciation rates to the coalescence tree, ignoring repeated speciation rates.

detaileddescription.para: Speciation rates are read from the speciation_rates object, which should have already been calculated.

briefdescription.para: Copy the in-memory database to file.

detaileddescription.para: This function should not be called if the database is already opened on disc, and won't do anything if it is.

briefdescription.para: Outputs important simulation data to a csv file. Overloaded version which automatically calls sortData() if no species richness is provided.
Outputs important simulation data to a csv file. This function will likely be remove in future versions as all simulation output is now contained in an SQLite database.

parameterdescription.para: the species richness of the tree with the minimum speciation rate. Outputted into the csv file

briefdescription.para: Sort and process the species list so that the useful information can be extracted from it.
Writes the times to the terminal for simulation information.
Generates the SQL database file from the full simulation data. This allows for greater analysis of the data after completion of the simulation.
Creates the SIMULATION_PARAMETERS table in the SQL database.
Creates a string containing the SQL insertion statement for the simulation parameters.

simplesect.para: string containing the SQL insertion statement

briefdescription.para: Pause the simulation and dump data from memory.
Checks the output folder exists and initiates the pause.
Saves the main simulation variables to file.

parameterdescription.para: the folder to save files into

briefdescription.para: Saves the active object to file.

parameterdescription.para: the folder to save files into

briefdescription.para: Saves the data object to file.

parameterdescription.para: the folder to save files into

briefdescription.para: Completes the pause routine and outputs the sql dump.

memberdef.argsstring: (string pausedir, string outdir, unsigned long seed, unsigned long task, unsigned long new_max_time)
memberdef.name: setResumeParameters

briefdescription.para: Sets the resume variables so that the simulation can be resumed.

detaileddescription.para: The pause directory can be the same as the output directory if it is desirable to save to the same location.

parameterdescription.para: the directory containing the pause folder for resuming the simulation
the directory to write simulation output to
the simulation seed
the simulation task
the maximum simulation time to run for in seconds (0 keeps old simulation max time)

briefdescription.para: Sets the resume variables to the defaults.
Loads the main simulation parameters from the save file into memory.
Loads the data object from the save file into memory.
Loads the active object from the save file into memory.
Checks for resuming and prints to the terminal.
Resumes the simulation from a previous state.

detaileddescription.para: Reads in the parameters and objects from file and re-starts the simulation.
